item.title: Docs: Prerequisites
item.description:
The Aiven Kubernetes Operator supports all major Kubernetes distributions, both locally and in the cloud.

To use the Operator, you need admin access to a Kubernetes cluster. We recommend kind for running it locally.

item.title: Docs: Cloning the GitHub Repository
item.description:
Let’s install the Operator from the GitHub repository.

First, clone this repository:

$ git clone git@github.com:aiven/aiven-kubernetes-operator.git
$ cd aiven-kubernetes-operator

Install the cert-manager Operator:

cert-manager is used to manage the Operator webhooks TLS certificates.

$ make install-cert-manager

Verify if the cert-manager was installed correctly by checking its namespace for running pods:

$ kubectl get pods --namespace cert-manager
NAME READY STATUS RESTARTS AGE
cert-manager-7dd5854bb4-vcg7f 1/1 Running 0 3m
cert-manager-cainjector-64c949654c-99z6k 1/1 Running 0 3m
cert-manager-webhook-6bdffc7c9d-dd4m5 1/1 Running 0 3m

Install the Custom Resources Definitions:

$ make install

Deploy the Operator:

$ make deploy

Verify the deployment by checking the Operator running pod:

kubectl get pods --namespace aiven-kubernetes-operator-system
NAME READY STATUS RESTARTS AGE
aiven-kubernetes-operator-controller-manager-b5487dff7-2pzb8 1/1 Running 0 5m55s

item.title: Docs: Verifying the Installation
item.description:
You can use the following commands to ensure a successful installation.

Verify if all the Operator Pods are READY and the STATUS is Running.

$ kubectl get pod -n aiven-kubernetes-operator-system
NAME READY STATUS RESTARTS AGE
aiven-kubernetes-operator-controller-manager-576d944499-ggttj 1/1 Running 0 12m

Verify if the cert-manager Pods are also running:

$ kubectl get pod --namespace cert-manager
NAME READY STATUS RESTARTS AGE

item.title: Docs: Uninstalling
item.description:
ðŸš¨ A word of caution ðŸš¨

Uninstalling the Operator may remove the resources created in Aiven, possibly resulting in data loss.

Uninstalling a GitHub-based installation

If you installed by cloning the GitHub repository, you can remove the Operator with the following command:

$ make undeploy
